Header.Name: languageDescriptionInfo
Header.Description: Groups together information on language descriptions

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Specifies the type of the resource being described or the type of the resource that a tool or service takes as input or produces as output
The type of the language description

item.@AppInfo: Value for languageDescriptionType; to be used for resources describing the morphological, syntactic etc. system (or part therof) of a language

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Information on the linguistic levels covered by the resource (grammar or lexical/conceptual resource)
Specifies the standards or the best practices to which the tagset used for the annotation or the encoding scheme of a resource (e.g. grammar / lexical resource) conforms
Name of the theoretic model applied for the creation or enrichment of the resource, and/or reference (URL or bibliographic reference) to informative material about the theoretic model used
Reference (name, bibliographic reference or link to url) for the formalism used for the creation/enrichment of the resource (grammar or tool/service)
An indication of the task performed by the grammar

item.@AppInfo: Value for task; for grammars used for anaphora resolution
Value for task; for grammars used for chunking (shallow syntactic parsing)
Value for task; for grammars used for parsing
Value for task; for grammars used for identifying noun phrases
Value for task; for grammars that are restricted to parsing titles
Value for task; for grammars that are restricted to parsing definitions
Value for task; for grammars used for analysis tasks
Value for task; for grammars used for language generation

CMD_Element.@Documentation: An indication of the grammatical phenomena covered by the grammar

item.@AppInfo: Value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that can recognise the structure of clauses
Value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover pp-attachment (attachment of prepositional phrases)
value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover structure of noun phrases
value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover coordination
value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover anaphora problems

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Indicates whether the grammar contains numerical weights (incl. probabilities)
Hardware required for running a tool and/or computational grammar
Provides further information on the running environment in free text mode
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
Indicates the position of the lexica that must or can be used with the grammar

item.@AppInfo: For lexica that are included in the grammar file
For lexica attached to a resource (e.g. as a different file in the same directory, or downloadable from another position); the element attachedLexiconPosition should be used for further information
For grammars that can use any lexicon as long as they of a compatible type; the element compatibleLexiconType must be used for further specification

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Indicates the position of the lexicon, if attached to the grammar
Type of (external) lexicon that can be used with the grammar

item.@AppInfo: Value for compatibleLexiconType; to be used for grammars that are compatible with wordnets
Value for compatibleLexiconType; to be used for grammars that need wordlists for their operation
Value for compatibleLexiconType; to be used for grammars that need lexica with morphological information for their operation

CMD_Element.@Documentation: Free text statement on the robustness of the grammar (how well the grammar can cope with misspelt/unknown etc. input, i.e. whether it can produce even partial interpretations of the input)
Free text statement on the shallowness of the grammar (how deep the syntactic analysis performed by the grammar can be)
Indicates whether the output of the operation of the grammar is a statement of grammaticality (grammatical/ungrammatical) or structures (interpretation of the input)
Specifies whether the resource is created automatically, manually or in interactive mode
Provides further information on the creation methods and processes
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described

Specifies the media type of the resource and basically corresponds to the physical medium of the content representation. Each media type is described through a distinctive set of features. A resource may consist of parts attributed to different types of media. A tool/service may take as input/output more than one different media types.
Specifies whether the resource is created automatically, manually or in interactive mode
Provides further information on the creation methods and processes
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
The full name or url or identifier of a resource related to the one being described
Specifies the media types that are linked to the media type described within the same resource
Provides further information on the way the media types are linked and/or synchronized with each other within the same resource
Whether video, text and textNumerical media type is synchronized with text within the same resource
Whether text, video or textNumerical media type is synchronized with audio within the same resource
Whether text or textNumerical media type is synchronized with video within the same resource
Whether text or textNumerical media type is synchronized with image within the same resource
Whether video or audio media type is synchronized with the textNumerical (representation of sensorimotor measurements) within the same resource
Indicates whether the resource includes one, two or more languages
Indicates whether the corpus is parallel, comparable or mixed
Provides further information on multilinguality of a resource in free text

The identifier of the language that is included in the resource or supported by the tool/service; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)

A human understandable name of the language that is used in the resource or supported by the tool/service; an autocompletion mechanism with values from the ISO 639 is provided in the editor, but the values can be subsequently edited for further specification (according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines)
Specifies the writing system used to represent the language in form of a four letter code as it is defined in ISO-15924
role of sizeInfo; to be used for the conversion to MetaShare
Specifies the size of the resource with regard to the sizeUnit measurement in form of a number
Specifies the unit that is used when providing information on the size of the resource or of resource parts
Specifies the type of the language variety that occurs in the resource or is supported by a tool/service
The name of the language variety that occurs in the resource or is supported by a tool/service
